Malta: Malta and Sicily are ruled by the Angevins. (to 1283)
Spain: Conquest of Murcia (1265–66): James the Conqueror laid siege to Murcia. Conquest of Murcia (1265–66): Murcia surrendered. Battle of Benevento: Manfred, King of Sicily, the king of Sicily, was killed during the conquest of the kingdom by Charles I of Anjou, count of Anjou. Alicante was incorporated into Castile.
